Title.evidence: A Prospective Cohort Study on Walking Performance in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective cohort study was conducted at the Sestre Milosrdnice University Hospital Centre, Zagreb, Croatia, from March 2022 to September 2023.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were colorectal cancer patients scheduled for elective open or laparoscopic abdominal surgery. Exclusion criteria included severe cardiorespiratory, musculoskeletal, or neurologic conditions.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of preoperative and postoperative walking performance in colorectal cancer patients undergoing surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Participants completed the EORTC QLQ-C30 and QoR 15 questionnaires and performed a 6-minute walk test (6MWT) 2 days before and 7 days after surgery.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 72 patients (mean age 62.48 years) were included in the final analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Significant differences were observed in walking performance pre- and post-surgery, with a higher average heart rate postoperatively (65 bpm pre-surgery vs. 99 bpm post-surgery, p = 0.008).
